attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Does the simple caution make sense since it is supposed to be for more minor crimes that it stay on a criminal record for life?
Just recently I got involved in an incident in a local night club that involved me getting into trouble.
I got released with no charges to come back answering bale to end up accepting a caution.
Not much was explained to me about what the implications were with this caution. I have been unemployed 6 going on 7 months now and have been finding it hard to find work locally and couldn't go and work some were else in the country if i had to come back up here and answer bail (aka me taking the caution). I remember the officer saying the caution is nothing. But to some 1 who is already struggling to work i think it is more than nothing. 
Most the work I do involves CRB checks etc as I work with computers for councils and the MOD. 
Well if their is no way of getting this taken of my record in say even 5 years you may as well add me to the ever growing unemployment list.
I think their should be a reasonable time limit that should be enforced and maintained. Unless we want a country of people unable to work due to these simple cautions.
